q: minivans' future WINDSOR, Ontario: Chrysler is debating the future of its minivans even as it starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. We need to completely rethink the minivan, CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. "We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile." Sergio Marchionne said that could mean

( Reuters)- Chrysler is working to refinance what its chief executive characterized as "shyster loans" that the Barack Obama administration extended as part of a bailout to keep the automaker from collapse in 2009. I want to pay back the shyster loans, Sergio Marchionne said at an industry conference, using a derogatory term for an unprincipled lawyer or politician.
